features.description: Supports combining multiple domain validation configurations when working with a single certificate.
Supports using a different certificate authority per certificate.
Supports using a custom Certificate Signing Request (CSR) generated from an external source.

list.title: Certify The Web
list.summary: Professional Automated Certificate Management UI for Windows servers, including direct support for IIS and a wide range of deployment tasks.
pros: Optimised for Windows users, with built-in support for IIS and the windows certificate store
Registered users have access to dedicated helpdesk ticketing
Support for a wide range of DNS APIs (28+, including many provided via Posh-ACME).
Support multiple auth config (e.g. mixing http and DNS validation, or using multiple DNS providers in one cert)
Extensive range of optional Deployment Tasks to perform scripting or to deploy to Apache, nginx, Azure Key Vault etc
cons: Commercial users require a license after their evaluation.

list.title: acme.sh
list.summary: Popular acme client written as unix shell script.
list.description: Unlike many other popular clients (which tend to default to using Let's Encrypt), acme.sh defaults to the ZeroSSL certificate authority for certificate orders.
pros: Optimized for Linux and other unix-like systems, broad compatibility
Support for a range of DNS APIs (external dependencies required).
cons: Only limited support for Windows (requires Cygwin or other compatible shells etc)

list.title: Certbot
list.summary: The official ACME client recommended by Let's Encrypt.
list.description: Certbot is a Python based command line tool with native support for Apache and nginx. Support is provided via the Let's Encrypt community site.
pros: Official ACME tool recommended by Let's Encrypt
Optimized for Linux, with built-in deployment options for Apache and nginx
Support for ~14 DNS APIs for DNS validation
cons: Only limited support for Windows (no IIS deployment etc, does not produce/store PFX)
Limited distribution support if not using snap to install

list.title: getssl
list.summary: A client implemented as a Unix (bash) shell script.

list.title: lego
list.summary: A Let's Encrypt/ACME client and library written in Go

list.title: Posh-ACME
list.summary: A PowerShell module and ACME client to create publicly trusted SSL/TLS certificates from an ACME capable certificate authority.
list.description: Posh-ACME is PowerShell module providing a set of cmdlets to work with ACME accounts and to order, validate and fetch certificates.
